Dear Ms. Allen-Pettway:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: Youth's extensive medical and psychiatric needs were not
documented appropriately.
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported/alleged the agency is not maintaining the medical records of Youth A
and Youth B as required.
A review of the information system for Youth A and Youth B indicated they had
completed physical and dental exams as required by this rule.
The information record for Youth A documented Youth A had a recent physical exam
02/01/2022 and dental exam 02/07/2022. In addition, Youth A had 5 documented
counseling appointments and 6 documented appointments with Beaumont Pediatrics
from 09/24/2021 to 04/05/2022.
The information record for Youth B documented Youth B had a recent physical exam
12/21/2021 and dental exam 02/07/2022. In addition, Youth B had 9 documented
appointments with Beaumont Pediatrics and 9 appointments with McLaren from
09/15/2021 to 03/30/2022.
The information record for Youth A and Youth B also indicated they each had CANS
assessments completed 10/15/2021, 01/28/2022, and 04/26/2022 that included
descriptions of the outcomes of those assessments.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(a) The provision of routine medical care.
(b) The provision of emergency medical, surgical, and
dental care.
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(i) For a child under 2 years of age, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 3 months
before being placed in foster care or a new physical
3

examination shall be completed within 30 calendar days
after being placed in foster care.
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
(iii) A physical examination every 14 months.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the services are
being provided and documented for Youth A and Youth B to
meet their medical and psychological/emotional needs.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: The agency did not include all caretakers in the
development of service plans.
INVESTIGATION:
The allegation was made/reported the agency did not include the relative grandfather in
the development of Parent Agency Treatment Plans (PATP) for Youth A and Youth B.
Youth A and Youth B are placed with their relative grandparents.
A review of the information record for Youth A and Youth B indicated PATP’s were
dated 04/12/2022, 01/14/2022, 10/14/2021, and 07/16/2021. The only PATP that
included a signature line for the grandfather was dated 04/12/2022 and there was not
adequate documentation to indicate why the grandfather was not included in other
PATP’s.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(1) An agency shall develop service plans with the child, the
child's parents or legal guardian, the referring agency, and
the other parties involved in providing needed services, or
medical care, unless the agency documents why any of the
entities have not been involved.
4

ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the agency did not
adequately include the grandfather in the treatment planning for
Youth A and Youth B or document why the grandfather should
not be included.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: The case worker did not complete home visits with Youth A and
Youth B in their placement as required.
INVESTIGATION:
A review of the information system indicated for the time period reviewed there were
monthly home visits completed and documented by the case manager. The time period
reviewed indicated there were home visits completed on 11/05/2021, 12/10/2021,
01/25/2022, and 02/25/2022 that were documented in the case record of Youth A and
Youth B.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and
parenting time that contains, at a minimum, all of the
following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
child and the foster parent in the foster parent's home at
least once every month.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the case worker for
Youth A and Youth B did complete visits to the foster home at
least once a month as required by this rule.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: The agency did not maintain Medical Passports and
provide them to the caretakers as required by FOM 801-03.
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported/alleged the agency did not provide the caretakers of Youth A and Youth
B with updated medical passports at least quarterly as required by FOM 801-03.
5

A review of the medical passport information for Youth A and Youth B documented
medical passports being provided to the caretakers of Youth A and Youth B 05/28/2021,
01/25/2022, 02/07/2022, 02/22/2022, and 02/28/2022. The documentation also
indicated the caretaker refused to sign the medical passports dated 01/25/2022,
02/07/2022, 02/22/2022, and 02/28/2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 801-03 All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined that based on the
dates of the medical passports that are documented, the
medical passports were not updated at least quarterly as
required by this standard. The most glaring lapse is in the time
period from 05/28/2021 to 01/25/2022.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: The agency did not complete the request for information
within the ten-day time period required by MCL 712A.13(a)(18).
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported/alleged the agency did not complete a request for information related to
the service plans, court reports, and medical reports for Youth A and Youth B within the
ten-day time frame required by this standard.
I reviewed email communications submitted to me by Complainant and Supervisor 1.
This information indicated an initial request for information was sent 01/10/2022.
Supervisor 1 reported in subsequent communications dated 02/04/2022 the agency had
not received the 01/10/2022 request for information. A subsequent communication by
Supervisor 1 dated 02/17/2022 indicated the agency was working on redacting some of
the information requested. Another communication dated 03/04/2022 from Supervisor 1
indicated the information requested was sent at that time, 03/04/2022.
6

APPLICABLE RULE
MCL 712A. If a child is placed in foster care, within 10 days after
13(a)(18) receipt of a written request, the agency shall provide the
person who is providing the foster care with copies of all
initial, updated, and revised case service plans and court
orders relating to the child and all of the child's medical,
mental health, and education reports, including reports
compiled before the child was placed with that person.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the agency did not
complete/provide the request for information within the 10-day
time frame required by MCL 712A.13(a)(18).
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION: The agency did not provide notice to the caretaker of Youth A and
Youth B regarding the scheduling of a Family Team Meeting (FTM).
INVESTIGATION:
It was reported/alleged the agency did not notify the caretaker of Youth A and Youth B
regarding the scheduling of an FTM as required by FTM 722-06B.
A review of the information system for Youth A and Youth B indicated the completion of
FTM’s 03/04/2021,06/14/2021,09/02/2021, 01/03/2022, and 03/25/2022. Attempts to
locate the required information associated with FTM documentation indicated the
following documents were not completed/uploaded into the system as required: 1109
(Notice/Invite), 1106 (Referral), 1105 (Activity), 1107 (Attendance), and 1104
(Information). The FTM of 06/14/2021 documented the 1105 (Activity), but all other
documentation for this FTM and the other FTM’s were not available as required.
APPLICABLE RULE
FTM 722-06B The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
MiSACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven business
days of the FTM.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined the information
related to the scheduling and completion of Family Team
Meetings was not documented to establish compliance with this
standard.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
